block.p: Antoinette Yeh, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Tsun-Cheng Yeh of Ardsley, N.Y., was married yesterday to Marc Justin Genovese, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Genovese of Avon, Conn. The Rev. Robert J. Allmen, a priest of the American Catholic Church in the United States, officiated at Oheka, the Otto Kahn house in Cold Spring Hills, N.Y.

Mr. and Mrs. Genovese are analysts for investment banks in New York. The bride works for Goldman, Sachs & Company; the bridegroom is an assistant vice president at Rabobank International, a Dutch bank.

Antoinette Yeh, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Tsun-Cheng Yeh of Ardsley, N.Y., was married yesterday to Marc Justin Genovese, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Genovese of Avon, Conn. The Rev. Robert J. Allmen, a priest of the American Catholic Church in the United States, officiated at Oheka, the Otto Kahn house in Cold Spring Hills, N.Y.

Mr. and Mrs. Genovese are analysts for investment banks in New York. The bride works for Goldman, Sachs & Company; the bridegroom is an assistant vice president at Rabobank International, a Dutch bank.

The bride, 26, graduated from New York University. Her father retired as a translator of Chinese at the United Nations. Her mother teaches at the Westchester Chinese School in Scarsdale, N.Y., and is also a tutor.

The bridegroom, 29, graduated from Lehigh University. His mother is an owner of Molds and More, a chocolate shop in Avon. His father is a consultant on business and a former partner in the tax section of PricewaterhouseCoopers, the New York accounting firm.
